faqs.question: How much does a residential metal roof cost?
faqs.answer: Residential metal roofing costs typically range from $8-$16 per square foot installed, depending on the material type, roof complexity, and local factors.

faqs.question: Do metal roofs increase home value?
faqs.answer: Yes, metal roofs can increase home value by 1-6% and offer up to 85% return on investment.

faqs.question: How long do residential metal roofs last?
faqs.answer: Quality metal roofs last 40-70+ years with minimal maintenance, compared to 15-20 years for asphalt shingles.

faqs.question: Are metal roofs noisy during rain?
faqs.answer: Modern metal roofs with proper insulation and underlayment are no noisier than other roofing materials.

faqs.question: Can metal roofs withstand Bay Area weather?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Metal roofs excel in Bay Area conditions - fire-resistant, earthquake-safe, and handle coastal salt air.
